intro: Uncaria procumbens, commonly known as the southern arrowroot or Brazilian arrowroot, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries containing elliptical seeds. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to grow in various soil types.
